intro: Aporosa sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe-fruit aporosa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is spherical and fleshy, containing several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
